thread.title: SpaceX recycles its rocket in historic first - CNET
thread.title_full: SpaceX recycles its rocket in historic first - CNET

author: Eric Mack
title: SpaceX recycles its rocket in historic first - CNET
text:
Español SpaceX recycles its rocket in historic first Elon Musk's space company has relaunched an orbital class rocket for the first time ever, making it perhaps the largest tin can to ever be recycled. 
The first successful relaunch of an orbital rocket. Video capture by Eric Mack/CNET 
Recycling isn't just for cans, bottles and really sucky gifts anymore. 
Nearly 15 years after setting out to revolutionize how we get to space, Elon Musk's company SpaceX successfully relaunched an orbital rocket Thursday that had previously been used to push a payload beyond the grasp of Earth's gravity. 
The Falcon 9 rocket that launched the SES-10 commercial communications satellite from NASA's Kennedy Space Center in Florida is the same rocket SpaceX used to send a Dragon spacecraft on a commercial resupply mission to the International Space Station in April of last year. 
A few minutes after sending the Dragon on its way April 8, the rocket successfully landed on the SpaceX drone ship "Of Course I Still Love You" in the Atlantic Ocean. It was the first such Falcon 9 landing attempt that didn't end in a spectacular explosion . Clearly, this rocket had to be the one. SpaceX redux
